info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 20 at 2:09PM PST until February 22 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Snow and areas of blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 14 inches. Locally higher amounts of 14 to 23 inches possible in the Cascades north of Mount Thielson. Northwest wind gusts of 40 mph across ridges and passes. * WHERE...South Central Oregon Cascades including Union Creek, Crater Lake, Diamond Lake, Crescent Lake. Highways 97, 62, 138, 230, and 58 will all be affected. * WHEN...Until 4 AM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible, depending on your mode of travel and winter driving preparedness. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...This snow will come in the form of showers with snowfall rates of a half inch to 1 inch per hour at times. The highest snowfall rates are likely to be Monday afternoon and evening. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
